department: Public Works and Government Services Canada
short_summary: Two pedestal mounted slewing knuckle boom cranes  eedure of 8 months, implementation: February 2023 to October 2023. Requirement is pursuant to the 2023-2024 National Accommodation Program
description: Trade Agreement: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)\\ Tendering Procedures: All interested suppliers may submit a bid\\ Competitive Procurement Strategy: Best Overall  Proposal\\ Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement: No\\ Nature of Requirements: \\\\n Pedestal mounted slewing knuckle boom cranes \\\\n Notice of proposed procurement modification number  001: Spelling corrections into the French language notice\\\\n REQUIREMENT:\\ The Canadian Coast Guard as a requirement for two (2) Pedestal mounted slewing knuckle boom cranes and delivery accordance with Annex \"A\"  Requirement and delivered on or before for the crane number 1: March 1, 2024 and for the crane number 2: August 1, 2024.\\\\n IMPORTANT NOTICE TO SUPPLIERS RE. BID SUBMISSION REQUIREMENTS\\\\n Due to the impacts from the COVID-19 pandemic, temporary measures are being taken on-site at the Pacific Region Bid Receiving Unit to encourage social distancing. The health and safety of staff and suppliers remains our top priority.\\\\n Suppliers are required to submit bids electronically using the Canada Post epost Connect application for the subject bid solicitation. This service allows suppliers to submit bids, offers and arrangements electronically to PWGSC Bid Receiving Units. This online service enables the electronic transfer of large files up to Protected B level.\\\\n To use epost Connect to submit your bid, or to get more information on its use, please send an email to the Pacific Region Bid Receiving Units generic address at TPSGC.RPReceptiondessoumissions-PRBidReceiving.PWGSC@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca \\\\\\\\\"\\
tags: Public Works and Government Services Canada
Pedestal mounted slewing knuckle boom cranes
Trade Agreement: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
